com.googlecode.aluminumproject.libraries.actions
Class DefaultActionFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.aluminumproject.libraries.AbstractLibraryElement
      com.googlecode.aluminumproject.libraries.actions.DefaultActionFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationElement, ActionFactory, LibraryElement
public class DefaultActionFactory
extends AbstractLibraryElement
implements ActionFactory

An action factory that takes an action class and examines it to collect information about it. By default, reflection will be used to compose information about the action and its parameters, but this can be overridden by annotating the action class.

If an action class is annotated with @ActionInformation, the action name will be the value of the name attribute. Otherwise, the name that is used is the name of the action class, humanised and written in lower case (so the action CamelCase would get the name camel case).

Action parameters are found by iterating through all of the action's setters that aren't annotated with @Ignored. Action parameters have the following properties:

  • A name: by default, this is the humanised name of the property, in lower case (so the method setName(String name) would result in a parameter with the name name);
  • A type: this is the value of the parameter of the setter (so the method setName(String name) would cause the parameter to have the type String);
  • Whether it is required or not: all parameters are considered optional by default.
The parameter's name, type, and whether it's required or not can be overridden by annotating its setter with @ActionParameterInformation.

Actions may support dynamic parameters by implementing the dynamically parameterisable interface. Any parameters that are supplied to the action factory but whose names don't match any of the found parameter names will be set as dynamic parameters.

Actions will be created using the configured configuration element factory. After an action has been created, all of its fields that are annotated with @Injected will be fed with an appropriate value.
